means: <正>不忠实的，不守信用的，背信弃义的

sentence.Network_en: She decided to divorce her increasingly faithless and unreliable husband.
sentence.Network_cn: 她决定与越来越花心、越来越靠不住的丈夫离婚。

sentence.Network_en: What if he was faithless to his friends and to his wife?
sentence.Network_cn: 要是他对妻子和朋友不忠怎么办?

sentence.Network_en: The disc has a heavy surface and the tone is faithless.
sentence.Network_cn: 那唱片表面粗陋,音质失真.

list.abs: so receive me brother with your faithless kiss ., 请用你那不忠的吻来接受我吧 , 兄弟.
...faithless 不忠不信不可靠背信弃义没有信仰faithless friend 不可靠的朋友faithless wife 不忠之妻
a faithless friend , wife , ally , etc., 不忠实的朋友 , 妻子 , 盟邦等.
He was found to be a faithless worker ., 人们发现他是一个不忠实的工人.
She was dumbfounded when the faithless husband told her he didn ' t love her any more ., 当那个不忠的丈夫告诉她已经不再爱她的时候 , 她变的哑然.

entry.tran: 背信弃义的;不忠实的;不诚实的
entry.def: If you say that someone is faithless, you mean that they are disloyal or dishonest.

example.ex: She decided to divorce her increasingly faithless and unreliable husband.
example.tran: 她决定与越来越花心、越来越靠不住的丈夫离婚。

means.word_mean: 1. deliberately and abominably disloyal or likely to betray trust or confidence;
